GOD.content: Derrida starts w/ Phaedo, w/ meletē tou thanatou, w/ Socrates’ play on aïdēs (“one who doesn’t see”) & haidēs, references Levinas, Heidegger, then: care about dying as relation to self, mystery or secrecy in formation of psychē
GOD.linkedContent: Derrida starts w/ Phaedo, w/ meletē tou thanatou, w/ Socrates’ play on aïdēs (“one who doesn’t see”) & haidēs, references Levinas, Heidegger, then: care about dying as relation to self, mystery or secrecy in formation of psychē

GOD.content: philosophy from the start, vigil (veille) over death that watches out for death and watches over death (qui veille à la mort et sur elle), as if over the very life of the soul, psychē as life, breath, pneuma, caring anticipation of dying, provisional mourning, vigil as veillée and wake [in English]
GOD.linkedContent: philosophy from the start, vigil (veille) over death that watches out for death and watches over death (qui veille à la mort et sur elle), as if over the very life of the soul, psychē as life, breath, pneuma, caring anticipation of dying, provisional mourning, vigil as veillée and wake [in English]

GOD.content: instant of decision is madness; like gift & “gift of death,” instant irreducible to presence, act of giving death, sacrifice, suspends labor of negative, labor itself, perhaps even work of mourning
GOD.linkedContent: instant of decision is madness; like gift & “gift of death,” instant irreducible to presence, act of giving death, sacrifice, suspends labor of negative, labor itself, perhaps even work of mourning

GT.content: is work of mourning still a desire to keep? gift vs. grief, gift as non-work [see FWT p. 78]
GT.linkedContent: is work of mourning still a desire to keep? gift vs. grief, gift as non-work [see FWT p. 78]

MONL.content: power this ‘alien’ [Oedipus] holds over ‘aliens’: innermost secret, sepulture, in exchange for salvation of city, which he refuses his daughters (refuses them a just ‘work of mourning’)
MONL.linkedContent: power this ‘alien’ [Oedipus] holds over ‘aliens’: innermost secret, sepulture, in exchange for salvation of city, which he refuses his daughters (refuses them a just ‘work of mourning’)

FK.content: khōra, secret, desert of the desert (last desert, before the first), neither a threshold nor a mourning, btwn event and possibility, or virtuality of the event, not the desert of revelation
FK.linkedContent: khōra, secret, desert of the desert (last desert, before the first), neither a threshold nor a mourning, btwn event and possibility, or virtuality of the event, not the desert of revelation

FK.content: spectral fantasy of dead, principal of life and sur-vival; life must be worth more than life, only has value in labour of infinite mourning > indemnified spectrality w/out limit
FK.linkedContent: spectral fantasy of dead, principal of life and sur-vival; life must be worth more than life, only has value in labour of infinite mourning > indemnified spectrality w/out limit

H.content: Oedipus gives the most poisoned gift, the deprivation of mourning, gives the mourning of mourning, no time of mourning, a respite of infinite time [for Freud, Oedipus’ gift is society]
H.linkedContent: Oedipus gives the most poisoned gift, the deprivation of mourning, gives the mourning of mourning, no time of mourning, a respite of infinite time [for Freud, Oedipus’ gift is society]

H.content: mourning is not allowed without a fixed (arrêté) place, monument, determinable topos, stopping point (arrêt) > promised w/out taking place, only possible mourning is an impossible one
H.linkedContent: mourning is not allowed without a fixed (arrêté) place, monument, determinable topos, stopping point (arrêt) > promised w/out taking place, only possible mourning is an impossible one

LOBL.content: is the double affirmation triumphant or a paradoxical phase in work of mourning [re: Freud’s manic fantasy]? p. ~101 one never writes in one’s own language or in a  foreign language > derive all consequences of this, from each element: hence the triumph (necessarily double & equivocal, because also a phase of mourning)
LOBL.linkedContent: is the double affirmation triumphant or a paradoxical phase in work of mourning [re: Freud’s manic fantasy]? p. ~101 one never writes in one’s own language or in a foreign language > derive all consequences of this, from each element: hence the triumph (necessarily double & equivocal, because also a phase of mourning)

LOBL.content: work of mourning is thematic in Glas, “Pas,” “Fors”
for Freud, triumph over mourning occurs w/ manic type, from Überwindung of normal success to Triumphieren of manic, how is this dissimulation possible?
LOBL.linkedContent: for Freud, triumph over mourning occurs w/ manic type, from Überwindung of normal success to Triumphieren of manic, how is this dissimulation possible?

LOBL.content: acc. Freud, Verdikt (verdict, sentence, arrêt): “object no longer exists,” inspires ego to break tie (Bindung) to destroyed object, manic triumph of work of mourning [?]
LOBL.linkedContent: acc. Freud, Verdikt (verdict, sentence, arrêt): “object no longer exists,” inspires ego to break tie (Bindung) to destroyed object, manic triumph of work of mourning [?]

LOBL.content: w/ Freud always un pas de plus et pas de thèse [re: speculation on death drive]
LOBL.linkedContent: w/ Freud always un pas de plus et pas de thèse [re: speculation on death drive]

LOBL.content: Derrida, pointing to confusions in Freud, worries that the reduction of double affirmation to Freud’s meaning of triumph (a narcissistic breaking of tie to destroyed object) would stain it w/ negativity of mourning, economic resenting, and melancholia [manic closer to melancholic than mourner]
LOBL.linkedContent: Derrida, pointing to confusions in Freud, worries that the reduction of double affirmation to Freud’s meaning of triumph (a narcissistic breaking of tie to destroyed object) would stain it w/ negativity of mourning, economic resenting, and melancholia [manic closer to melancholic than mourner]

LOBL.content: Derrida refers to his deuil du deuil in “Ja ou le faux-bond” and his half-mourning
LOBL.linkedContent: Derrida refers to his deuil du deuil in “Ja ou le faux-bond” and his half-mourning

LOBL.content: to speak of writing, triumph, as living on, is to denounce [Freud’s] manic fantasy (not w/out repeating it)
LOBL.linkedContent: to speak of writing, triumph, as living on, is to denounce [Freud’s] manic fantasy (not w/out repeating it)

POO.content: no vegetarian can avoid “sublimity of mystical cannibalism, cannibalism in mourning”
POO.linkedContent: no vegetarian can avoid “sublimity of mystical cannibalism, cannibalism in mourning”

SPOM.content: three things which decompose the single thing (spirit, specter, king): 1) mourning, localize, identify the dead, know who and where [ontology, hermeneutics, philosophy] 2) language, voice, “scull had a tongue in it” 3) work, “spirit of the spirit” is work, spirit works
SPOM.linkedContent: three things which decompose the single thing (spirit, specter, king): 1) mourning, localize, identify the dead, know who and where [ontology, hermeneutics, philosophy] 2) language, voice, “scull had a tongue in it” 3) work, “spirit of the spirit” is work, spirit works

SPOM.content: mourning ontologizes remains, make them present, name them, localizes the dead
SPOM.linkedContent: mourning ontologizes remains, make them present, name them, localizes the dead

SPOM.content: [re: dominant discourse on Marxism] the triumphal stage of work of mourning, maniac, jubilatory, animistic magic, rhythm of cadenced march [“Marx is dead,” long live capitalism]
SPOM.linkedContent: [re: dominant discourse on Marxism] the triumphal stage of work of mourning, maniac, jubilatory, animistic magic, rhythm of cadenced march [“Marx is dead,” long live capitalism]

SPOM.content: by mourning Marxism we inherit it
conjuration, work of mourning: make sure dead will not come back
SPOM.linkedContent: conjuration, work of mourning: make sure dead will not come back

SPOM.content: reflexive return of conjuration: those who inspire fear conjure themselves, conjure very specter they represent (conjuration in mourning for itself, turns against itself)
SPOM.linkedContent: reflexive return of conjuration: those who inspire fear conjure themselves, conjure very specter they represent (conjuration in mourning for itself, turns against itself)

SPOM.content: for Marx, “only this,” only practicality, work, production, techniques (see also p. 177) can get “the ghost”: “when one has destroyed a phantomatic body, the real body remains”
SPOM.linkedContent: for Marx, “only this,” only practicality, work, production, techniques (see also p. 177) can get “the ghost”: “when one has destroyed a phantomatic body, the real body remains”

SPOM.content: [the “actual relations (wirkliche Verhältnisse)” must be dealt w/ once ghost has been exorcised]
SPOM.linkedContent: [the “actual relations (wirkliche Verhältnisse)” must be dealt w/ once ghost has been exorcised]

SPOM.content: Marx opposes work [see pp. 161, 163] to Stirner's work of mourning, his hyper-phantomality, Marx determines differance or deferral as practical and as delay of reappropriation [he doesn’t eliminate death, expropriation, at heart of living—puts it to work?]
SPOM.linkedContent: Marx opposes work [see pp. 161, 163] to Stirner's work of mourning, his hyper-phantomality, Marx determines differance or deferral as practical and as delay of reappropriation [he doesn’t eliminate death, expropriation, at heart of living—puts it to work?]

SPOM.content: phenomenological ego is a specter, phanesthai is the possibility of the specter, brings death, gives death, works at mourning [see pp. 237-38n Husserl’s noeme, irréellité]
SPOM.linkedContent: phenomenological ego is a specter, phanesthai is the possibility of the specter, brings death, gives death, works at mourning [see pp. 237-38n Husserl’s noeme, irréellité]

SPOM.content: Glas, “Fors” concern the problematic border btwn incorporation and introjection, effective but limited pertinence of this conceptual opposition, as well as the one [conceptual opposition] that separates failure from success in the work of mourning
SPOM.linkedContent: Glas, “Fors” concern the problematic border btwn incorporation and introjection, effective but limited pertinence of this conceptual opposition, as well as the one [conceptual opposition] that separates failure from success in the work of mourning

HERP.content: to strive to recall—nostalgia; Aristotle, metaphysics: reactive nostalgia, a mourning for originary philein, semideafness that hears but not the originary gathering of logos
HERP.linkedContent: to strive to recall—nostalgia; Aristotle, metaphysics: reactive nostalgia, a mourning for originary philein, semideafness that hears but not the originary gathering of logos

HERP.content: moment of question as struggle, moment of Eros when philosophy becomes a question tensed/plunged into mourning, jealous/inquisitive about being?
HERP.linkedContent: moment of question as struggle, moment of Eros when philosophy becomes a question tensed/plunged into mourning, jealous/inquisitive about being?

POOF.content: “infinite abysses of imputability open on to mourning in the shadow of each and every event of death”
POOF.linkedContent: “infinite abysses of imputability open on to mourning in the shadow of each and every event of death”

POOF.content: one cannot survive w/out mourning, not even God can escape this tautology
POOF.linkedContent: one cannot survive w/out mourning, not even God can escape this tautology

POOF.content: time of surviving (btwn mourning & its possibility) gives itself in withdrawal, self-delivers, self-effaces 2x—constancy & beginning again: indefinite repetition of inaugural moment, keeps memory & anticipates > contre-jour of this contretemps, condition/possibility of friendship
POOF.linkedContent: time of surviving (btwn mourning & its possibility) gives itself in withdrawal, self-delivers, self-effaces 2x—constancy & beginning again: indefinite repetition of inaugural moment, keeps memory & anticipates > contre-jour of this contretemps, condition/possibility of friendship

POOF.content: Augustine’s abyssal calculation, after death of his friend [Confessions IV], his close reading of Aristotle’s friends are ‘one soul in bodies twain’: survivre, ou non, au nom de l’autre? survive for yourself or person you’re mourning? question of gift, donner au nom de l’autre, a narcissism that only occurs in name of other
POOF.linkedContent: Augustine’s abyssal calculation, after death of his friend [Confessions IV], his close reading of Aristotle’s friends are ‘one soul in bodies twain’: survivre, ou non, au nom de l’autre? survive for yourself or person you’re mourning? question of gift, donner au nom de l’autre, a narcissism that only occurs in name of other

POOF.content: for Nietzsche, if woman is not even part of humanity [via inability to befriend], man is not yet man either, men are equally late [Augustine], though woman lagging > be patient in the face of this ‘not yet’: mourned anticipation, a threshold naming—May we have it one day!
POOF.linkedContent: for Nietzsche, if woman is not even part of humanity [via inability to befriend], man is not yet man either, men are equally late [Augustine], though woman lagging > be patient in the face of this ‘not yet’: mourned anticipation, a threshold naming—May we have it one day!

POOF.content: returning ghost [of Zarathustra?] who promises is a testament, a ‘this is my body’ offered again to brothers > no mourning but mourning of brother?
POOF.linkedContent: returning ghost [of Zarathustra?] who promises is a testament, a ‘this is my body’ offered again to brothers > no mourning but mourning of brother?

POOF.content: deferred mourning as friendship, no possible introj./incorp. > no successful death w/out remainder, that would be the return of the father (what brothers don’t want!) > this is what brothers are conjuring: love of the father (a scene framed thus: w/out a woman)
POOF.linkedContent: deferred mourning as friendship, no possible introj./incorp. > no successful death w/out remainder, that would be the return of the father (what brothers don’t want!) > this is what brothers are conjuring: love of the father (a scene framed thus: w/out a woman)

POOF.content: great canonical meditations on friendship (Cicero, Montaigne, Blanchot) all belong to experience of mourning > through the irreplaceable of the named, they always advance in testimonial order to confide/refuse death of unique to a universalizable discourse > simultaneously found/destabilize all oppositions, opens to abyss, se fracture
POOF.linkedContent: great canonical meditations on friendship (Cicero, Montaigne, Blanchot) all belong to experience of mourning > through the irreplaceable of the named, they always advance in testimonial order to confide/refuse death of unique to a universalizable discourse > simultaneously found/destabilize all oppositions, opens to abyss, se fracture

POOF.content: Blanchot [on Foucault’s death]: “the intellectual friendship that his death, so painful to me, today allows me to declare to him, as (tandis que) I recall the words attributed by Diogenes Laertes to Aristotle: ‘Oh my friends, there is no friend’” > incredible audacity of this tandis que, and the singular use of the colon, an act of punctuation that unfurls a veil of mourning—will one have ever punctuated w/ more rigor?
POOF.linkedContent: Blanchot [on Foucault’s death]: “the intellectual friendship that his death, so painful to me, today allows me to declare to him, as (tandis que) I recall the words attributed by Diogenes Laertes to Aristotle: ‘Oh my friends, there is no friend’” > incredible audacity of this tandis que, and the singular use of the colon, an act of punctuation that unfurls a veil of mourning—will one have ever punctuated w/ more rigor?

MPM.content: two impossible mournings: 1) incorporate other as idol 2) refuse to incorporate: infinite remove
MPM.linkedContent: two impossible mournings: 1) incorporate other as idol 2) refuse to incorporate: infinite remove

MPM.content: the being “in us” of other in bereaved memory, not resurrection of other himself, can’t be included in narcissistic fantasy of subjectivity closed in on itself > other so marks narcissistic structure that being “in us” becomes coming of the other
MPM.linkedContent: the being “in us” of other in bereaved memory, not resurrection of other himself, can’t be included in narcissistic fantasy of subjectivity closed in on itself > other so marks narcissistic structure that being “in us” becomes coming of the other

MPM.content: summary of work of mourning:
MPM.linkedContent: summary of work of mourning:

MPM.content: no true mourning
MPM.linkedContent: no true mourning

MPM.content: no friendship w/out finitude
MPM.linkedContent: no friendship w/out finitude

MPM.content: all relation to others carries signature of memoirs-from-beyond-the-grave
MPM.linkedContent: all relation to others carries signature of memoirs-from-beyond-the-grave

MPM.content: this finitude (finitude of friendship) does not take the form of a limit, but takes the form of the trace of the other in us, the other’s irreducible presence
MPM.linkedContent: this finitude (finitude of friendship) does not take the form of a limit, but takes the form of the trace of the other in us, the other’s irreducible presence

MPM.content: finitude of memory, formed by trace of other in us > approach or remembrance of future  (memory of mourning, mourning of memory)
MPM.linkedContent: finitude of memory, formed by trace of other in us > approach or remembrance of future (memory of mourning, mourning of memory)

MPM.content: self only appears in bereaved allegory (even before actual death of other) [see p. 33]
MPM.linkedContent: self only appears in bereaved allegory (even before actual death of other) [see p. 33]

MPM.content: Baudelaire links mourning and obsession
MPM.linkedContent: Baudelaire links mourning and obsession

MPM.content: can we mourn?: 1) are we capable of it? 2) do we have the right?
MPM.linkedContent: can we mourn?: 1) are we capable of it? 2) do we have the right?

MPM.content: experience at heart of memory (Being & law), memorial, memoirs, mournful in essence, contracts itself together in impossible affirmation of mourning [affirmation is possible]
MPM.linkedContent: experience at heart of memory (Being & law), memorial, memoirs, mournful in essence, contracts itself together in impossible affirmation of mourning [affirmation is possible]

MPM.content: impossible affirmation of mourning must be possible—impossible here is the Other, as he comes to us: as a mortal, to us mortals
MPM.linkedContent: impossible affirmation of mourning must be possible—impossible here is the Other, as he comes to us: as a mortal, to us mortals

MPM.content: we come to ourselves through memory of possible mourning, knowledge older than ourselves, de Man might say: unreadability of mourning
MPM.linkedContent: we come to ourselves through memory of possible mourning, knowledge older than ourselves, de Man might say: unreadability of mourning

MPM.content: inconsolable [infinitely responsible] before finitude of memory: [want memory to be infinite?] possibility of impossible commands whole rhetoric of mourning, describes essence of memory > w/ dark light of this nothing (death of other) we learn other resists closure of our interiorizing memory [Freud’s “normal” “work of mourning” (ideally, quasi-literally devouring body/voice of other)]
MPM.linkedContent: inconsolable [infinitely responsible] before finitude of memory: [want memory to be infinite?] possibility of impossible commands whole rhetoric of mourning, describes essence of memory > w/ dark light of this nothing (death of other) we learn other resists closure of our interiorizing memory [Freud’s “normal” “work of mourning” (ideally, quasi-literally devouring body/voice of other)]

MPM.content: mimetic interiorization not just fictive, is origin of fiction, takes place in a body, makes place for body, soul, “ours” > death constitutes and makes manifest limits of me, us, obliged to harbor something greater than us w/in us
MPM.linkedContent: mimetic interiorization not just fictive, is origin of fiction, takes place in a body, makes place for body, soul, “ours” > death constitutes and makes manifest limits of me, us, obliged to harbor something greater than us w/in us

MPM.content: il faut: one must follow the trace, remember that which did not exist, the law [Being and law], only there in the aporia of mourning and prosopopoeia: 1) success fails: other becomes part of us, bear him in us, like a future 2) failure succeeds: aborted interorization, respect for other as other, other remains alone, outside us, in his death > schema makes true mourning impossible
MPM.linkedContent: il faut: one must follow the trace, remember that which did not exist, the law [Being and law], only there in the aporia of mourning and prosopopoeia: 1) success fails: other becomes part of us, bear him in us, like a future 2) failure succeeds: aborted interorization, respect for other as other, other remains alone, outside us, in his death > schema makes true mourning impossible

MPM.content: uncontrollable necessity, nonsubjectivizable law of thought beyond interiorization, beyond un-mourning thought mourning > can we accept it? affirm it? can no longer become a question
MPM.linkedContent: uncontrollable necessity, nonsubjectivizable law of thought beyond interiorization, beyond un-mourning thought mourning > can we accept it? affirm it? can no longer become a question

MPM.content: we think this (immeasurable grief & life of faithful friendship): sublimity of mourning w/out sublimation, w/out Freud’s triumph, w/out ‘paranoid fear’
MPM.linkedContent: we think this (immeasurable grief & life of faithful friendship): sublimity of mourning w/out sublimation, w/out Freud’s triumph, w/out ‘paranoid fear’

MPM.content: the essence of the proper name prevents “true mourning”
MPM.linkedContent: the essence of the proper name prevents “true mourning”

MPM.content: inscription of memory effaces interiorizing recollection, not because of external limit or finite limitation of memory, but because of [allegorical] structure of relation to Other
MPM.linkedContent: inscription of memory effaces interiorizing recollection, not because of external limit or finite limitation of memory, but because of [allegorical] structure of relation to Other

MPM.content: Gedächtnis [w/out Erinnerung], a thinking memory, engagement beyond negativity, a reaffirmation of engagement, a memory that has mourned the dialectic (which is mourning itself), memory w/out mourning, rigorous fidelity of an affirmation, barely “amnesic”
MPM.linkedContent: Gedächtnis [w/out Erinnerung], a thinking memory, engagement beyond negativity, a reaffirmation of engagement, a memory that has mourned the dialectic (which is mourning itself), memory w/out mourning, rigorous fidelity of an affirmation, barely “amnesic”

MPM.content: thinking, not bereaved interiorization, thinks at boundaries, thinks the boundary, the limit of interiority
MPM.linkedContent: thinking, not bereaved interiorization, thinks at boundaries, thinks the boundary, the limit of interiority

MPM.content: always necessary to excuse oneself for appropriating to oneself this work of mourning
MPM.linkedContent: always necessary to excuse oneself for appropriating to oneself this work of mourning

A.content: an originary mourning unthought by Heidegger, Levinas, Freud
A.linkedContent: an originary mourning unthought by Heidegger, Levinas, Freud

A.content: “culture of death”—a tautology? each culture treats death differently, w/ different partitions, culture of death = history of death (cult of ancestors, rituals of mourning/sacrifice)
A.linkedContent: “culture of death”—a tautology? each culture treats death differently, w/ different partitions, culture of death = history of death (cult of ancestors, rituals of mourning/sacrifice)

A.content: Heidegger not interested in revenant or mourning—just death itself, not its figures or experiences of demise (Ableben)
A.linkedContent: Heidegger not interested in revenant or mourning—just death itself, not its figures or experiences of demise (Ableben)

A.content: for Derrida, in contrast to Heidegger [Freud & Levinas too?], mourning, revenance, spectrality, living-on, surviving: non-derivable categories or non-reducible derivations
A.linkedContent: for Derrida, in contrast to Heidegger [Freud & Levinas too?], mourning, revenance, spectrality, living-on, surviving: non-derivable categories or non-reducible derivations

A.content: all politics require time & space of mourning, a topolitology of sepulcher, anamnesic (thematic) relation to spirit as revenant, open hospitality to guest as ghost [in English] whom one holds, as he holds us, hostage
A.linkedContent: all politics require time & space of mourning, a topolitology of sepulcher, anamnesic (thematic) relation to spirit as revenant, open hospitality to guest as ghost [in English] whom one holds, as he holds us, hostage

PAS.content: Blanchot: work of mourning is the inverse of dying
PAS.linkedContent: Blanchot: work of mourning is the inverse of dying

SH.content: mourning: reading itself > readability: tribute of lost singularity (“beauty” pays)
SH.linkedContent: mourning: reading itself > readability: tribute of lost singularity (“beauty” pays)

SH.content: in Celan’s “Die Schleuse” “Kaddish” is lost, “a word that was looking for me,” that which opens possibility of mourning what has been lost beyond a trace [loss of mourning]
SH.linkedContent: in Celan’s “Die Schleuse” “Kaddish” is lost, “a word that was looking for me,” that which opens possibility of mourning what has been lost beyond a trace [loss of mourning]

SH.content: no worse loss than death of name (still, a date remains) > mourning, interiorization of other in Erinnerung, the preserving of other in sepulcher/epitaph, is denied us; words incinerated beyond sepulcher can return as ghosts > incinerated beyond of date, words lost w/out sepulcher
SH.linkedContent: no worse loss than death of name (still, a date remains) > mourning, interiorization of other in Erinnerung, the preserving of other in sepulcher/epitaph, is denied us; words incinerated beyond sepulcher can return as ghosts > incinerated beyond of date, words lost w/out sepulcher

F.content: incorporation (magic, secret, cryptic, instantaneous) seals loss of object, the dead, an exquisite corpse, loves the dead safe (save) inside me, as dead; introjection (slow, gradual, laborious, effective) dead save in me as living, enlarge the self (introj. as normal mourning)
F.linkedContent: incorporation (magic, secret, cryptic, instantaneous) seals loss of object, the dead, an exquisite corpse, loves the dead safe (save) inside me, as dead; introjection (slow, gradual, laborious, effective) dead save in me as living, enlarge the self (introj. as normal mourning)

FWT.content: work is always work of mourning, internalizes, appropriating idealization
FWT.linkedContent: work is always work of mourning, internalizes, appropriating idealization

FWT.content: Hamlet also machine of repression in politics, spectrality governs problematic of mourning & technics, media, virtual reality > general logic of spectrality
FWT.linkedContent: Hamlet also machine of repression in politics, spectrality governs problematic of mourning & technics, media, virtual reality > general logic of spectrality

FWT.content: those who internalize, who think they can assimilate, appropriate, habituate, subjectivize the worst [in a work of mourning], immunize, sacralize, and idealize it
FWT.linkedContent: those who internalize, who think they can assimilate, appropriate, habituate, subjectivize the worst [in a work of mourning], immunize, sacralize, and idealize it

FWT.content: successful mourning is failed mourning, is unfaithful: denies alterity of dead other, of death as other, “narcissizes” the dead other > same goes for integration of immigrant/foreigner
FWT.linkedContent: successful mourning is failed mourning, is unfaithful: denies alterity of dead other, of death as other, “narcissizes” the dead other > same goes for integration of immigrant/foreigner

FWT.content: faithfulness prescribes impossibility of mourning at once [St. Augustine’s “I live on for my friend” in POOF]
FWT.linkedContent: faithfulness prescribes impossibility of mourning at once [St. Augustine’s “I live on for my friend” in POOF]

P.content: Kant: examples are wheelchairs (Gängelwagen) [roulettes] of judgment, those who don’t have enough Mutterwitz, the sick, need these wheelchairs, prostheses that replace nothing
P.linkedContent: Kant: examples are wheelchairs (Gängelwagen) [roulettes] of judgment, those who don’t have enough Mutterwitz, the sick, need these wheelchairs, prostheses that replace nothing

P.content: Hegel: there is play in examples, they play, Beispielen
P.linkedContent: Hegel: there is play in examples, they play, Beispielen

P.content: Derrida, via Hegel: examples divert energy of ergon, introduce chance & abyss into necessity of Mutterwitz > this can make one lose one’s head, a Russian roulette (death drive and mourning of labor in experience of beautiful), to put into play pleasure w/out enjoyment
P.linkedContent: Derrida, via Hegel: examples divert energy of ergon, introduce chance & abyss into necessity of Mutterwitz > this can make one lose one’s head, a Russian roulette (death drive and mourning of labor in experience of beautiful), to put into play pleasure w/out enjoyment

P.content: “negative pleasure” of sublime, respect, admiration, is different from “positive pleasure” of beautiful, and unique from beauty’s negativity (the work of of mourning in beauty), which was already singular, a negativity w/out negativity, sans sans sans, sans of pure cut, sans fin of finality
P.linkedContent: “negative pleasure” of sublime, respect, admiration, is different from “positive pleasure” of beautiful, and unique from beauty’s negativity (the work of of mourning in beauty), which was already singular, a negativity w/out negativity, sans sans sans, sans of pure cut, sans fin of finality

ATIA.content: in avowing his desire to avoid appropriative projection before animal’s gaze, to avoid tradition [Benjamin, Heidegger] that assigns deep sadness (Traurigkeit) to animal’s Benommenheit (inability to respond to name it’s given, inability to experience being “as such”)
ATIA.linkedContent: in avowing his desire to avoid appropriative projection before animal’s gaze, to avoid tradition [Benjamin, Heidegger] that assigns deep sadness (Traurigkeit) to animal’s Benommenheit (inability to respond to name it’s given, inability to experience being “as such”)

ATIA.content: for Benjamin, animal/nature not sad because mute but mute because sad: not the sadness of passivity, of not being able to name, but of receiving one’s name > a foreshadowing of mourning
ATIA.linkedContent: for Benjamin, animal/nature not sad because mute but mute because sad: not the sadness of passivity, of not being able to name, but of receiving one’s name > a foreshadowing of mourning

ATIA.content: every case of naming announces a death to come in the surviving of a ghost, we feel mortal because name seeks to save us, assure survival, it is the feeling (promise) of dying > how could one refuse the animal this experience of death? deprive the animal of nomination?
ATIA.linkedContent: every case of naming announces a death to come in the surviving of a ghost, we feel mortal because name seeks to save us, assure survival, it is the feeling (promise) of dying > how could one refuse the animal this experience of death? deprive the animal of nomination?

SW.content: fault or election, veil is a sign of mourning
SW.linkedContent: fault or election, veil is a sign of mourning

SW.content: Cixous’ seeing in mourning of the unseen
SW.linkedContent: Cixous’ seeing in mourning of the unseen

SW.content: “I’d like to be done w/ mourning [for the veil]…perhaps [H.C.] already succeeded in that”
SW.linkedContent: “I’d like to be done w/ mourning [for the veil]…perhaps [H.C.] already succeeded in that”

DST.content: no rhythm w/out caesura > antirhythmic [Hölderlin], arrhythmic
DST.linkedContent: no rhythm w/out caesura > antirhythmic [Hölderlin], arrhythmic

DST.content: interrupts alternation, constraint of opposition, even double bind [cf. p. 225]
DST.linkedContent: interrupts alternation, constraint of opposition, even double bind [cf. p. 225]

DST.content: Lacoue-Labarthe: caesura is empty moment, intrusion of prophetic word (Tiresias)
DST.linkedContent: Lacoue-Labarthe: caesura is empty moment, intrusion of prophetic word (Tiresias)

DST.content: caesura marks withdrawal of divine, plays at & undoes mourning > doubles work of mourning (the speculative, the dialectic, the opposition, the identification, the nostalgic interiorization, even the double bind of imitation), caesura takes one’s breath away (coupe le souffle), open mouth, pour donner, pour recevoir: quand elle a de la chance, gives one speech
DST.linkedContent: caesura marks withdrawal of divine, plays at & undoes mourning > doubles work of mourning (the speculative, the dialectic, the opposition, the identification, the nostalgic interiorization, even the double bind of imitation), caesura takes one’s breath away (coupe le souffle), open mouth, pour donner, pour recevoir: quand elle a de la chance, gives one speech

DPi.content: time of bandages: when body not found—when Jesus is not dead but not yet elevated, resuscitated > the lodging made ready for literature: ascension w/out ascension, elevation w/out elevation, immanence w/out immanence, imminent yet unaccomplished resurrection
DPi.linkedContent: time of bandages: when body not found—when Jesus is not dead but not yet elevated, resuscitated > the lodging made ready for literature: ascension w/out ascension, elevation w/out elevation, immanence w/out immanence, imminent yet unaccomplished resurrection

DPi.content: moment before noli me tangere [p. 35n unique moment, since Jesus is generally a touching Jesus], moment where mourning can’t set to work, there’s no corpse > when Mary and Antigone weep over absence of burial
DPi.linkedContent: moment before noli me tangere [p. 35n unique moment, since Jesus is generally a touching Jesus], moment where mourning can’t set to work, there’s no corpse > when Mary and Antigone weep over absence of burial

PIO.content: death as moment of mourning when breaking the mirror is most necessary & most difficult > “Fable” tells story of this crossing over to the other, other side of mirror
PIO.linkedContent: death as moment of mourning when breaking the mirror is most necessary & most difficult > “Fable” tells story of this crossing over to the other, other side of mirror

PIO.content: no matter how outstretched (tendus) we are toward the other, everything we say or do remains w/in us: part of us wounded, conversing w/ ourselves in work of mourning, of Erinnerung
PIO.linkedContent: no matter how outstretched (tendus) we are toward the other, everything we say or do remains w/in us: part of us wounded, conversing w/ ourselves in work of mourning, of Erinnerung

PIO.content: even if metonymy of other w/in ourselves already constituted our relation to living other, [actual?] death brings relation into a more abundant light (un plus de lumière) > makes the breaking of the mirror more necessary (difficult): at instant of death, limit of narcissistic reappropriation is terribly sharp > must no longer be concerned w/ other in ourselves—yet, that’s all we can be concerned w/ > narcissistic wound enlarges (s’accroît) for want of being (ne plus pouvoir être) narcissistic, no longer appeased in that Erinnerung we call work of mourning
PIO.linkedContent: even if metonymy of other w/in ourselves already constituted our relation to living other, [actual?] death brings relation into a more abundant light (un plus de lumière) > makes the breaking of the mirror more necessary (difficult): at instant of death, limit of narcissistic reappropriation is terribly sharp > must no longer be concerned w/ other in ourselves—yet, that’s all we can be concerned w/ > narcissistic wound enlarges (s’accroît) for want of being (ne plus pouvoir être) narcissistic, no longer appeased in that Erinnerung we call work of mourning

PIO.content: beyond internalizing memory to Gedächtnis, another way to think
PIO.linkedContent: beyond internalizing memory to Gedächtnis, another way to think

PIO.content: via Eros/Psyche myth, impossibility of seeing & touching oneself at same time: mourning, mirror, specularization [quantum physics?]
PIO.linkedContent: via Eros/Psyche myth, impossibility of seeing & touching oneself at same time: mourning, mirror, specularization [quantum physics?]

PSSS.content: “mad”: invent destination, address, addressee of grievance
PSSS.linkedContent: “mad”: invent destination, address, addressee of grievance

PSSS.content: “mad” as a movement w/ no target, no telos, where movement of (counter-)transference has not yet taking place, is seeking its place, its subjects [is this an analytic site?]
PSSS.linkedContent: “mad” as a movement w/ no target, no telos, where movement of (counter-)transference has not yet taking place, is seeking its place, its subjects [is this an analytic site?]

PSSS.content: threat of death, whose mourning/grievance would be born in advance, invades place left vacant for transferential destination
PSSS.linkedContent: threat of death, whose mourning/grievance would be born in advance, invades place left vacant for transferential destination

HST.content: tears, work of mourning, as process of hospitality > also, the culture of smile, welcoming of a promise
HST.linkedContent: tears, work of mourning, as process of hospitality > also, the culture of smile, welcoming of a promise

HST.content: Tupinamba give tearful welcome: stranger hailed as revenant; hôte as ghost (spirit or revenant, holy spirit)
HST.linkedContent: Tupinamba give tearful welcome: stranger hailed as revenant; hôte as ghost (spirit or revenant, holy spirit)

HST.content: survival guilt, reproach oneself before everything for which Auschwitz remains proper name/metonymy > asking forgiveness for being-there (être-là); (Nietzsche, Heidegger, Levinas) debt prior to any borrowing: unacquittable fact of being-there, a being there originarily guilty
HST.linkedContent: survival guilt, reproach oneself before everything for which Auschwitz remains proper name/metonymy > asking forgiveness for being-there (être-là); (Nietzsche, Heidegger, Levinas) debt prior to any borrowing: unacquittable fact of being-there, a being there originarily guilty

HST.content: asking for forgiveness occurs in the unforgivable; guilt of survivor (not only concentration camp survivor), anyone who is mourning; work of mourning is always “I survive”
HST.linkedContent: asking for forgiveness occurs in the unforgivable; guilt of survivor (not only concentration camp survivor), anyone who is mourning; work of mourning is always “I survive”

HST.content: for Levinas, when I mourn, I feel responsible, I murder: “my own,” those I believe I killed, I love > ineluctable empire of phantasm at origin of meaning [Blanchot also links thought of death to murder]
HST.linkedContent: for Levinas, when I mourn, I feel responsible, I murder: “my own,” those I believe I killed, I love > ineluctable empire of phantasm at origin of meaning [Blanchot also links thought of death to murder]

HST.content: all poetical declarations of love as sickness of the other? > an other always more ancient and more to come than me, as if I carry w/in me the mourning of me carried by the other
HST.linkedContent: all poetical declarations of love as sickness of the other? > an other always more ancient and more to come than me, as if I carry w/in me the mourning of me carried by the other

HST.content: impossible grammar of “I love you”: tragic/comic desire to want to die first and to want to survive you to console you at the time of my death (guard in me your mourning of me)
HST.linkedContent: impossible grammar of “I love you”: tragic/comic desire to want to die first and to want to survive you to console you at the time of my death (guard in me your mourning of me)

HST.content: mourning as both interiorized incorporation & presentation of external dead body > substitueries [“substitution” w/ “killings”]
HST.linkedContent: mourning as both interiorized incorporation & presentation of external dead body > substitueries [“substitution” w/ “killings”]

C.content: paradigm does not show a coffin, it shows itself in its coffin, Titus-Carmel does the paradigm down, to death > works at mourning w/out example: learns to go w/out (se passer)
C.linkedContent: paradigm does not show a coffin, it shows itself in its coffin, Titus-Carmel does the paradigm down, to death > works at mourning w/out example: learns to go w/out (se passer)

C.content: introjection of mors, morceau [Lacan’s objet a?] always lets drop a heterogenous remainder of incorporation > infinite analysis of mourning btwn introj./incorp.
C.linkedContent: introjection of mors, morceau [Lacan’s objet a?] always lets drop a heterogenous remainder of incorporation > infinite analysis of mourning btwn introj./incorp.

C.content: do the impossible: make mourning one’s mourning (faire du deuil son deuil)
C.linkedContent: do the impossible: make mourning one’s mourning (faire du deuil son deuil)

TN.content: nothing takes place but place (rien n’a lieu que du lieu), extensions tiennent lieu (taking place of) > every metonymy announces, remains a sign of mourning
TN.linkedContent: nothing takes place but place (rien n’a lieu que du lieu), extensions tiennent lieu (taking place of) > every metonymy announces, remains a sign of mourning

TN.content: Psyche as life, breath: mourning life itself

for Nancy, excès de la façon (fashioning) sur l’essence, et que l’une supplée l’autre, at origin of feeling oneself touch oneself; spectral revenant, prosthesis at heart of (self-)feeling > revenant, btwn life/death, dictates impossible mourning, sans fin—life itself [re: spacing irreducible to extensio]; p. 321n shouldn’t this spacing (what I call differance/trace) be linked to Heidegger’s tension of distancing (Gespanntheit) rather than Descartes’ extensio or even Freud’s Ausdehnung
TN.linkedContent: for Nancy, excès de la façon (fashioning) sur l’essence, et que l’une supplée l’autre, at origin of feeling oneself touch oneself; spectral revenant, prosthesis at heart of (self-)feeling > revenant, btwn life/death, dictates impossible mourning, sans fin—life itself [re: spacing irreducible to extensio]; p. 321n shouldn’t this spacing (what I call differance/trace) be linked to Heidegger’s tension of distancing (Gespanntheit) rather than Descartes’ extensio or even Freud’s Ausdehnung

TN.content: absolute mourning of Psyche (life itself) > mourning mourning, mourning w/out work of mourning
TN.linkedContent: absolute mourning of Psyche (life itself) > mourning mourning, mourning w/out work of mourning

TN.content: for Psyche, for a psyche altogether exposed to outside & other, there’s no autobiography: mourning autobiography (not just any mourning)
TN.linkedContent: for Psyche, for a psyche altogether exposed to outside & other, there’s no autobiography: mourning autobiography (not just any mourning)

TN.content: being unimaginable gives rise to phantasms, allegories, figures, metonymies: technics > no overcoming (surmonté) this mourning w/out mourning [of autobiography] by any "work of mourning”
TN.linkedContent: being unimaginable gives rise to phantasms, allegories, figures, metonymies: technics > no overcoming (surmonté) this mourning w/out mourning [of autobiography] by any "work of mourning”

TN.content: Nancy: philosophy as work of mourning, work of representation, incorporation, profits from death (jouir de la mort), philosophy doesn’t know true mourning (w/out limits: ashes & tears)
TN.linkedContent: Nancy: philosophy as work of mourning, work of representation, incorporation, profits from death (jouir de la mort), philosophy doesn’t know true mourning (w/out limits: ashes & tears)

TN.content: pre-originary mourning (re: Husserl’s vigilant stance on alter-ego) tied to motif of exappropriation—interiorization, even introjection, never achieved
TN.linkedContent: pre-originary mourning (re: Husserl’s vigilant stance on alter-ego) tied to motif of exappropriation—interiorization, even introjection, never achieved

TN.content: “heart”: ultimate place of mourning, sanctuary of what one keeps when one can’t keep anything, name of what infinitely exceeds the inside
TN.linkedContent: “heart”: ultimate place of mourning, sanctuary of what one keeps when one can’t keep anything, name of what infinitely exceeds the inside

TN.content: the selfsame (même) heart exappropriates instant touched by other, no possible reappropriation (absolute mourning)
TN.linkedContent: the selfsame (même) heart exappropriates instant touched by other, no possible reappropriation (absolute mourning)

ATM.content: to bury a text that erased the name of God [dysgraphy] is not to annihilate it (burn the whole thing): by inhuming the fault, one keeps it; a work of mourning which can either 1) be successful through spiritual interiorization, introjection 2) or else be paralyzed in melancholic pathology (incorporation)
ATM.linkedContent: to bury a text that erased the name of God [dysgraphy] is not to annihilate it (burn the whole thing): by inhuming the fault, one keeps it; a work of mourning which can either 1) be successful through spiritual interiorization, introjection 2) or else be paralyzed in melancholic pathology (incorporation)

E.content: poetic speech, beyond finite commerce (out of circulation), yet of infinite value: the universal analogical equivalent, the value of values; through poetry, work of mourning turns hetero-affection into auto-affection, producing maximum of disinterested pleasure
E.linkedContent: poetic speech, beyond finite commerce (out of circulation), yet of infinite value: the universal analogical equivalent, the value of values; through poetry, work of mourning turns hetero-affection into auto-affection, producing maximum of disinterested pleasure

E.content: Derrida compares the work of mourning to the sublime, both allow negative pleasures to be reappropriated by economic calculation
E.linkedContent: Derrida compares the work of mourning to the sublime, both allow negative pleasures to be reappropriated by economic calculation

E.content: vomit gives too much enjoyment, suspends the suspension of non-consummation (which accompanies pleasure bound up w/ representation): it burns up all work as mourning work
E.linkedContent: vomit gives too much enjoyment, suspends the suspension of non-consummation (which accompanies pleasure bound up w/ representation): it burns up all work as mourning work

E.content: if mourning always consists in biting off the bit (le mors), a remainder, a corpse, the disgusting can only be vomited
E.linkedContent: if mourning always consists in biting off the bit (le mors), a remainder, a corpse, the disgusting can only be vomited

AD.content: “work of mourning”: confused and terrible expression
AD.linkedContent: “work of mourning”: confused and terrible expression

CF.content: forgiveness not pure when aimed at reconciliation, determined finalities, at reestablishing normality by a work of mourning
CF.linkedContent: forgiveness not pure when aimed at reconciliation, determined finalities, at reestablishing normality by a work of mourning

CF.content: must forgiveness saturate the abyss (suture, reconcile)? but who could object to imperative of reconciliation? amnesties, work of mourning—political strategy, psycho-therapeutic economy
CF.linkedContent: must forgiveness saturate the abyss (suture, reconcile)? but who could object to imperative of reconciliation? amnesties, work of mourning—political strategy, psycho-therapeutic economy

CIN.content: entrust words to a page: better to inflame you, eat yourself up immediately, not a tomb that offers patience of mourning, but a tomb of a tomb, deprived of patience of mourning
CIN.linkedContent: entrust words to a page: better to inflame you, eat yourself up immediately, not a tomb that offers patience of mourning, but a tomb of a tomb, deprived of patience of mourning

CIN.content: incineration celebrates perhaps the nothing of the all, destruction w/out return, mad w/ its desire, desperate disseminal affirmation but also its opposite: “no” to the work mourning, “no” of fire > how to accept working for his Highness (monseigneur) mourning?
CIN.linkedContent: incineration celebrates perhaps the nothing of the all, destruction w/out return, mad w/ its desire, desperate disseminal affirmation but also its opposite: “no” to the work mourning, “no” of fire > how to accept working for his Highness (monseigneur) mourning?

CIN.content: you only have mass or volume when covered w/ cinders, like covering one’s head w/ ashes in sign of mourning
CIN.linkedContent: you only have mass or volume when covered w/ cinders, like covering one’s head w/ ashes in sign of mourning

CIN.content: rebellion against Phoenix, affirmation of fire w/out place or mourning
CIN.linkedContent: rebellion against Phoenix, affirmation of fire w/out place or mourning

OG.content: the fact that there can be a usurpation of writing, the need to chase out writing as other (blindness, wandering, mourning)—a possibility that must be questioned
OG.linkedContent: the fact that there can be a usurpation of writing, the need to chase out writing as other (blindness, wandering, mourning)—a possibility that must be questioned

CIR.content: mourning capitalizes, saving loves me [proximity loves Derrida too]
CIR.linkedContent: mourning capitalizes, saving loves me [proximity loves Derrida too]

CIR.content: where you hear me no longer, where you hear yourself no longer, I am content to turn around you: you do not even know that you are wearing mourning for me
CIR.linkedContent: where you hear me no longer, where you hear yourself no longer, I am content to turn around you: you do not even know that you are wearing mourning for me

CIR.content: the satyr galatea that I am, half-mourning satyr > the splitting of the ego, in me, is no transcendental claptrap
CIR.linkedContent: the satyr galatea that I am, half-mourning satyr > the splitting of the ego, in me, is no transcendental claptrap

SPEC.content: cremation: a form of Fortgehen, quite singular effects on work of mourning
SPEC.linkedContent: cremation: a form of Fortgehen, quite singular effects on work of mourning

SPEC.content: several families (in French analytic movement) bear same name [Freud’s name?] w/out knowing it [via Marie Bonaparte; “au moment où on croit décacheter (unsealed) un testament”]
SPEC.linkedContent: several families (in French analytic movement) bear same name [Freud’s name?] w/out knowing it [via Marie Bonaparte; “au moment où on croit décacheter (unsealed) un testament”]

SPEC.content: condition of filiation, mid-mourning (demi-deuil) [see “Ja ou le faux-bond”]: introjection and/or incorporation: la barre entre et et/ou ou > structurally as necessary as it is necessarily impure
SPEC.linkedContent: condition of filiation, mid-mourning (demi-deuil) [see “Ja ou le faux-bond”]: introjection and/or incorporation: la barre entre et et/ou ou > structurally as necessary as it is necessarily impure

SPEC.content: exemplary narcissistic wound [for Freud]: jealousy over birth of new baby, proof of infidelity of object of child's affection, undoes (défait) the bind (lien) (Bindung) to parent of opposite sex
SPEC.linkedContent: exemplary narcissistic wound [for Freud]: jealousy over birth of new baby, proof of infidelity of object of child's affection, undoes (défait) the bind (lien) (Bindung) to parent of opposite sex
